learning_objective: Model how computer hardware and software work together as a system to accomplish tasks.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex loves playing online games after school with their friends. However, they often get frustrated when they cannot keep up due to the lag on their computer. They understand that both the hardware and the software of their computer affect the performance of their games. One possible solution to reduce the lag is to update their graphics driver. In this situation, what is the graphics driver and why would updating it potentially reduce the lag?",
    "Answer1": "The graphics driver is a type of software that controls the graphics card of Alex's computer. Updating it could help reduce the lag because it might contain optimizations for the game Alex is playing.",
    "Answer2": "The graphics driver is a piece of hardware that connects the graphics card to the monitor. Updating it refers to purchasing and installing a more advanced model, which can enhance the game's visual performance.",
    "Answer3": "The graphics driver is a storage device where game data is stored. Updating it means allocating more storage to the game, which can reduce the time it takes to load game sequences.",
    "Answer4": "The graphics driver is a physical component of the motherboard that is responsible for the sound effects in a game. Updating it would improve the game's audio quality, but it would not reduce the lag.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The graphics driver, which is a type of system software, controls how the graphics card (a hardware component) interacts with the rest of the computer system. Updating the graphics driver can help optimize the performance of the graphics card and improve the game's response time, thus potentially reducing lag."
}
